text:
Hello and welcome to Cupcake Addiction's Mickey
Mouse and Minnie Mouse Cupcake Tutorial where

I'll be showing you how to make both of these
gorgeous little Mickey and Minnie Mouse cupcakes.

Tools and equipment that we will be using
today:
I've got some just regular sticky tape.

I've got a couple of cupcakes that I've made
and I've baked mine in red cupcake liners
today but that's a little bit optional.
I've got our printable template.
So you've got a Minnie Mouse.

She's got her little red and white polka dot
dress on.

And you've got Mickey Mouse and he's just
in his little red overalls with yellow buttons.

I will leave a link to that printable in the
description box below.
And you'll need to print those out.

I used a 210 gsm, not quite a cardboard but
quite a thick paper.

I've got a disposable piping bag and I've
just paired that with an open tipped, round
nozzle.
I've got some whipped cream today.

I've gone with the cookies and cream sort
of a flavor for my cupcakes so I'm using whipped

cream but you can use any buttercream frosting
or any store-bought frosting.
I've got a strawberry.

Do try and get a strawberry with a nice and
pointed tip on the end.
We're going to use that to make our bow.
We've got some large Oreo cookies.
Some mini Oreo cookies.
A spoon.
And a knife.
So let's get started.
The first thing that we want to do...

You see here that Minnie's already dressed
in her little polka dot dress.
So we just dress Mickey.

Now what you want to remember, these are a
little bit of a one-sized-fits-all template.

So you wrap them around and they are going
to overlap a little bit.
You can trim them off if you want.

But everyone's cupcake is going to be slightly
different sizes.

So what you want to try and do whenever you're
using any cupcake liner or cupcake wrapper

is you want to try and have that cupcake fairly
well even with the top of your cupcake liner

even if it means that it's pushing it up a
centimeter or so at the bottom.
That's totally fine.

What you want to try and avoid doing is having
your cream or your frosting touching too much

of this liner because it will actually [whip]
through it or seep through it a little bit

and it will start to discolor your pretty
little patty pan there or your pretty little
cupcake wrapper.
So I'm happy that that's a good width.

And I'm just going to pop a little bit of
sticky tape on the back there.

So once you've got your little cupcake wrapper
ready to go, you can just drop that cupcake
in.
And you'll see there, almost perfect.

It's really really nice at the top, little
bit of space at the bottom and Minnie Mouse
was much the same.
So now you want to take that whipped cream.
We're going to spoon it into the piping bag.
So this is heavy, all whipping cream.
It's about a 40% milk fat content.

And I've just whipped that until it's nice
and light and fluffy.
Pop that into your piping bag.
You want to take your strawberry.

And we're just going to prepare Minnie's little
bow.
So with the bow, it really is very easy.
You only need the tip of the strawberry.

I'm just going to cut the tip off and then
you're going to cut that in half.

When you pop that on Minnie's head, we're
going to put it tip to tip and you've got
yourself a tiny, little, polka dot bow.
Absolutely easy!

Now we're going to just pipe a nice, low,
smooth style swirl.

Now we do have a whole tutorial on our channel
My Cupcake Addiction dedicated to this style
of swirl.

So if you're having trouble getting it nice
and neat, you can head on over there.

I will leave a link to that in the description
box below.

And you just want to start in the center of
your Minnie Mouse and come out, all the way

around until you've got just a nice, white
swirl there.

Now because I'm using fresh cream, I'm going
to have to refrigerate my cupcakes.

Obviously, if you're using buttercream frosting
or a different style of frosting, you won't
need to.
So I'm going to turn them to face me.

Now do keep an eye on where the back of your
Mickey Mouse and your Minnie Mouse are because

you want to make sure that you're positioning
them with those details from the front of
them, at the front where they belong.
So I'm going to turn them to face me now.

And I'm going to take large Oreo cookie on
Mickey.

I'm going to position it on top of him and
2 of those small Oreo cookies and just position
those.

Now as I position it, I'm just flattening
them down a little bit and just making sure
that they're all pretty even.
There's Mickey ready to go.
And then we're going to do the same with Minnie.

So making sure that I've got the front of
her dress, I'm going to push down that Oreo
cookie.
And then we're going to add in those 2 ears.

Now with Minnie, you want to take just a little
tiny bit of cream, not so much that it's going

to be noticeable on the outsides -- 1 and
then 2.

So there you've got your gorgeous Mickey Mouse
and Minnie Mouse cupcakes -- really really

easy and ready to go for your next Disney
occasion.

I hope you've enjoyed watching this tutorial
as much as I've enjoyed making it for you.
And as always, thank you very much for watching.
